Vulnerability¶

long double bayesVulnerability(Distribution &prior)¶

Prior Bayes vulnerability. It is the probability of an adversary guessing a secret correctly in one try.

Parameters

prior – Prior distribution on the set of secrets.

Returns

Bayes vulnerability of a prior distribution.

long double bayesVulnerability(Hyper &hyper)¶

Posterior Bayes vulnerability. It is the expected probability of an adversary guessing a secret correctly in one try. It is calculated weighting the Bayes vulnerability of each posterior by its probability of occuring.

Parameters

hyper – A hyper-distribution.

Returns

Bayes vulnerability of a hyper-distribution.

long double gVulnerability(Gain &gain)¶

Prior g-vulnerability. It is a function that measures how vulnerable a secret is. This value corresponds to the expected gain of an adversary guessing the secret correctly, given a set of actions that she/he can take.

Parameters

gain – A gain function.

Returns

g-vulnerability of a prior distribution.

long double gVulnerability(Hyper &hyper, Gain &gain)¶

Posterior g-vulnerability. It is the expected gain of the adversary over the inner distributions.

Parameters

  • hyper – A hyper-distribution.

  • gain – A gain function for a set of secrets.

Returns

g-vulnerability of a hyper-distribution.

long double kTries(Distribution &prior, int k)¶

Prior k-tries. It is the probability of the adversary guess the value of the secret correctly in k tries, looking into a prior distribution.

Parameters

  • prior – Prior distribution on the set of secrets.

  • k – Number of tries the adversary has to guess the secret.

Returns

A probability.

long double kTries(Hyper &hyper, int k)¶
Parameters

  • hyper – A hyper-distribution.

  • k – Number of tries the adversary has to guess the secret.

Returns

The probability of an adversary guessing the secret correctly in k tries, looking into a hyper-distribution.

Leakage measures¶

Note

  • \(V_g(\pi)\): Prior g-vulnerability for a prior distribution \(\pi\).

  • \(V_g([\pi \triangleright C])\): Posterior g-vulnerability of a hyper-distribution \([\pi \triangleright C]\) resulted from a channel \(C\) and a prior \(\pi\).

long double additiveLeakage(Hyper &hyper, Gain &gain)¶

The absolute difference between the posterior g-vulnerability and the prior g-vulnerability.

Parameters

  • hyper – A hyper-distribution.

  • gain – A gain function for a set of secrets.

Returns

\(V_g([\pi \triangleright C]) - V_g(\pi)\)

long double multiplicativeLeakage(Hyper &hyper, Gain &gain)¶

The relative difference between the posterior g-vulnerability and the prior g-vulnerability.

Parameters

  • hyper – A hyper-distribution.

  • gain – A gain function for a set of secrets.

Returns

  • If \(V_g(\pi) \neq 0\) and \(V_g([\pi \triangleright C]) \neq 0\) it returns \(\frac{V_g([\pi \triangleright C])}{V_g(\pi)}\).

  • If \(V_g(\pi) = 0\) and \(V_g([\pi \triangleright C]) = 0\) it returns 1.

  • If \(V_g(\pi) = 0\) and \(V_g([\pi \triangleright C]) \neq 0\) it returns \(+\infty\).

See the Definition 5.11 here for more details about the return value of multiplicative leakage.

Entropy¶

long double guessingEntropy(Distribution &prior)¶

Guessing entropy of a prior probability distribution.

Parameters

prior – Prior distribution on the set of secrets.

Returns

The expected number of tries needed by the adversary to guess the secret correctly.

long double guessingEntropy(Hyper &hyper)¶

Guessing entropy of a hyper-distribution.

Parameters

hyper – A hyper-distribution.

Returns

The expected number of tries needed by the adversary to guess the secret correctly, looking to all possible worlds (inner distributions).

long double shannonEntropy(Distribution &dist)¶

Shannon entropy of a probability distribution is a way to measure the secrecy of a secret.

Parameters

dist – Prior distribution on a set of secrets.

Returns

Shannon entropy of a probability distribution. The returned value is in the interval \([0,\log_2 (n)]\), where \(n\) is the number of elements in the distribution.

long double shannonEntropy(Hyper &hyper)¶

The Shannon entropy of a hyper-distribution is a way to measure the secrecy of a secret, looking to all possible worlds (inner distributions).

Parameters

hyper – A hyper-distribution.

Returns

Shannon entropy of a hyper-distribution. The returned value is in the interval \([0,\log_2 (y)]\), where \(y\) is the number of outputs of the channel pointed by hyper.
